website_summaries.verdict: The light-up feature of this smaller globe makes it great for kids.
pros: A switch activates several LEDs to illuminate the globe, and it can double as a night light
The colorful map is perfect for teaching young children basic geography
cons: The globe is made of plastic and is smaller than most competitors

customer_reviews.title: Small world after all :)
customer_reviews.text: Nice lighted globe, but a little smaller than expected. I've included a photo next to a credit card/gift card for sizing. It's smaller than a basketball, but good for kids to handle. The globe is well balanced- won't tip over easily- and is evenly lighted (with 4 AA batteries). It is well detailed and even has a legend! The frame is plastic- I hope it holds up or we will end up with a detached globe soccer ball! Overall great little globe for learning geography!
customer_reviews.author: Tim S.

customer_reviews.title: It's cool and lights up
customer_reviews.text: It's cool and lights up, but I think at $30 it's overpriced - it's plastic-y and very lightweight and should probably be sold at half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ili

customer_reviews.title: This is a very cheaply make product. The globe ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very cheaply made product. The globe was falling apart when my son opened it up and I had to take the globe apart in the middle and re-tape it. Yes that right its literally just taped together.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy McGarvey

customer_reviews.title: My 3 year old loves his illuminated globe, although ...
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old loves his illuminated globe, although now he's convinced that a trip to Russia isn't that far because we can just go over Canada and Alaska (ha!). But really, it's helping him understand the shape of the Earth and the concept of countries and oceans. It makes him excited, and so I'm excited too.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: this is 1st 1 star I have given and would not recommend this small globe for 30 bucks
customer_reviews.text: Very small globe for the price. I went to Walmart after getting this and got bigger one for 10 less.why not put the capital cities of the states vslisting little known cities. Put in Sacramento for ca. Or Trenton for n.j..this is 1st 1 star I have given and would not recommend this small globe for 30 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: jack

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality. My son loves this globe
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality. My son loves this globe, but it falls apart every single day and I have to snap it back onto the stand. This is just from him holding it in his lap and spinning it and studying it. Yesterday, after dropping the globe on the floor, it split apart at the equator. It cannot seem to stand up to normal handling by children.
customer_reviews.author: David Morton

customer_reviews.title: We absolutely love this little globe
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love this little globe. The package says ages 8+, but it's perfect for our 3 1/2 year old granddaughter! Clearly printed countries, states, cities, light enough for her to carry around, stable base (does not topple over ever), small enough to fit on dresser, small table, in tent, anywhere! And is illuminated! She knew it was the "planet Earth" as soon as she saw it (learned it in nursery school!), so we all were very thrilled and thought the timing was perfect. A great little 'starter' globe - bought it with the new book "Where We Are" - a perfect combo for a perfect stage of development. Highly recommended!!!!
customer_reviews.author: fern eisgrub

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality but small
customer_reviews.text: The globe is nice quality for the price - easy to read text. However I was surprised when I received it to find it is only 8" diameter...standard globe size is 12". I must have missed the size in the description. I think it would be good if the size is included in the product heading.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn K. Leigh

customer_reviews.title: but I do like it. And it's a great night light
customer_reviews.text: This globe is a little smaller than I had imagined, but I do like it. And it's a great night light, which is safe because it's powered by four AA batteries, not plugged into the wall. So I can put it almost anywhere I want, since it doesn't have to be plugged in. I had trouble finding a Phillips screwdriver small enough to open the battery compartment and insert the batteries, which are not included. I'm used to the newer doors that slide open to reveal the battery compartment, without needing any tools.
customer_reviews.author: Tessa B. Dick

customer_reviews.title: No cords!! Perfect night light
customer_reviews.text: Love this!!! We got an amazon open box warehouse deal...great purchase. My 3 yr old,loves this..no cords!!!
customer_reviews.author: jml

customer_reviews.title: Very small
customer_reviews.text: I think I Gonne return it, this is way too small. I was expecting a normal size. I didn’t check the detail I guess. But for thst price? I think it’s a bit pricy.
customer_reviews.author: Ring

customer_reviews.title: Great Globe for kids
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the illuminated Globe, a bit smaller than I expected, but will work for my 7 year old Granddaughter who is learning about the continents and oceans of the world. The light feature is very nice, especially if the globe is in a dark room. It's perfect for a child to learn about different places in the world.
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Readable Globe
customer_reviews.text: We use this globe as part of our class room. We home school our 9 year old grand daughter and use the globe often to find locations referenced in science, social studies, art, music and literature Beautiful colors, lots of info and a readable typeface
customer_reviews.author: Retired Disabled CA Guy

customer_reviews.title: Cute Lil Globe
customer_reviews.text: The globe is great. Lovely illumination. My only complaint it's so small for me. I'm an adult who's just learning geography, so I need one that's a little larger.
customer_reviews.author: GENEA D.

customer_reviews.title: Fun for kids
customer_reviews.text: My 5-year-old granddaughter has been very interested in maps, and her playroom contains several world, country, state, and solar system maps on her walls. She's very good at identifying places and finding them, but she couldn't extrapolate the flat maps to the round planets on her solar system map. I got this globe for her so she could see the connection, and it was almost instantaneous. The fact that it lights up makes it even more exciting for her. She shares it with her almost 4-year-old sister, and I bought another one for her 5-year-old cousin. Great for kids and the globes seem to be well constructed.
customer_reviews.author: Swift

customer_reviews.title: It's better than nothing
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I admit I only paid $20 on prime day. It's not worth sending back, because it does give you an idea of where things are. But it's tiny, maybe 10" in diameter. Consequently, all the lettering is very small and I can't read any of it without glasses. I did not expect great quality and it specifies that it is for children and maybe it meets that need. But it's cheap and not very attractive. Spend more and get something that is a bit better. It is, however, far superior to trying to relate to the world on a flat map.
customer_reviews.author: Magill

customer_reviews.title: Plastic but strong. Uses 4 batteries. Illuminates the room
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely happy with this Earth 🌍 globe “lamp”. Yes, it can be a lamp because illuminates my son’s room perfectly. He is 7, second grade and will be studying countries, continents, seas etc so l looked in several websites and l found this . Totally worth it. Plastic? Yes! But not as cheap as l read in some reviews. I pushed or squeezed the globe with both hands and no damage was caused, so it is plastic but sturdy. Uses 4 AA batteries. No pictures attached because there are enough from other kind reviewers.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree

customer_reviews.title: Good tool for teaching my children about the world.
customer_reviews.text: My 6yo daughter was delighted with this globe. It is on the small side which is great for our small house. While the printing is not as clear as it could be with a different material it is clear enough. I do use a magnifying glass, and found that the conical magnifying glass from our “Educational Insights GeoSafari Jr. BugWatch” we bought from amazon worked great. All told I’m very happy. Pros Compact Nice light level Kids liked it Cons Plastic printing not perfect Battery compartment needs a screw driver
customer_reviews.author: Chay

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to early conversations about other countries/cultures
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 6yr old and 4yr old for Christmas to help launch our initial conversations about other countries, cultures, and languages. I lived all over the world growing up, so it's very important for me to try to raise "global citizens" who are aware of worlds outside of the U.S. This globe is not huge (maybe 11" diameter), but it lights up and it has the basics that provide a good scale. I love it and I'd highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: MDMama

customer_reviews.title: Illuminates.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 6 yr old grandson. Since schools remains closed, I thought he would like learning about the oceans, continents, etc. His dad does his home schooling w/ him at present. His dad said my grandson truly enjoys this globe, so they incorporate using this globe in their school lessons, along w/ his twin. He is a hands on learner. He tells us about the oceans and rivers, where they are located. This was a great gift for him. The fact it illuminates is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: maggie  portz

customer_reviews.title: Light bulb burns out after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I only gave this globe 1 star because 0 stars was not an option. Bought this for my child as a Christmas gift. Worked fine until 2 weeks ago. Replaced with brand new batteries but the light will not turn back on. There is no way to replace the light bulb. Complete waste of money and useless now. Only lasted 5 months. Return window is gone and so now we have a globe that doesn't do what it was supposed to. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: JoshCube

customer_reviews.title: Works, but looks cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: My son got this for Christmas, as far as a globe, it is fine. A little smaller than I realized, but it works. My biggest complaint is that the seam around the equator looks like the entire thing is held together with clear tape and gives the appearance of being cheaply made. If I were choosing again, I would have gone with a more solid globe that is larger and more well made.
customer_reviews.author: G Baumann

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality. The light flickers whenever you turn it ...
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than I thought. Terrible quality. The light flickers whenever you turn it or lightly touch it, like it has a short. I would rather have paid $10-15 for this, not $30. Not for young kids as it is very fragile. The only reason I am not returning it is my daughter loves it already. I would definitely NOT buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: K. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Just the right size
customer_reviews.text: My Great Grandson asked for a globe for Christmas. He is only 7 so when I saw this globe I knew it woul be perfect. I love the bright colors and the fact that it lights up. I thought when I ordered it it said it was 10 inches but when it came it was only 8 inches. That was my only disappointment. But, I think he will love it anyway. Thank you,
customer_reviews.author: Pet Lover

customer_reviews.title: This globe is very cute and my daughter was super excited to open it on Christmas morning
customer_reviews.text: This globe is very cute and my daughter was super excited to open it on Christmas morning. The colors are great and the size was perfect. However, when we installed the batteries it did not illuminate, which is very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Megan B. Kenney

customer_reviews.title: Global fun
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this illuminated World Globe as a gift for my seven years old grandson's birthday. He's been wanting a world globe for the longest but he didn't expect it to glow at night which is a plus and in addition it's a great learning tool. He can already point out Ghana on the globe where his father was born.I highly recommend this illuminated globe to every parent who has a child that loves to learn about places around the world.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is the perfect size for my 5 & 8 year olds
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect size for my 5 & 8 year olds, who are having more fun with a globe than I ever expected! They are making up games (Legos flying around the globe), and while it just seems like silliness, they are learning a lot. I love that the text is legible and not excessive. At their age, my kids would just be overwhelmed by or disinterested in a globe that is cluttered with names of everything. It seems well-made and durable too. We didn't have the 4 AA batteries until after owning it for a week, and when they saw it light up, they were so excited!
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful tool/resource for an aged avid PBS addict.
customer_reviews.text: I have a globe in another room, two wall maps in my husband's den... But none are easily or quickly available when a PBS or Nova special says, but doesn't show, a location. For me the final straw was the PBS comment in a Blue Planet episode....."southeast coast of Alaska". East??? Really, East??....So I searched for small globes....And found this. I love it. Lit so a 72 year-old can read it day or night....Hand sized, close by....my questions answered in seconds....It needs gentle care I'm happy to give it.
customer_reviews.author: A Mully

customer_reviews.title: it needs ac adapter
customer_reviews.text: The only reason this cool little nightlight globe did not get 5 stars from me is because it will only operate on batteries. It looks neat. Seems to be very accurate. Makes a beautifully glowing nightlight for my girls. But only runs on batteries. My girls like looking at it while they are going to bed. Alternatively it could have a built in auto-shut off timer, if ac power is not an option.
customer_reviews.author: aaron

customer_reviews.title: Educational night light
customer_reviews.text: Our 2 granddaughters have explored the world with this night light. It keeps them comfort in the night and they have learned where different continents, oceans, seas and countries are. They are knowledgeable about other parts of the world and that folks look different and have different cultures. They are ready to travel.
customer_reviews.author: Steven D. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect small globe
customer_reviews.text: Great little globe. While it may be listed as a toy, I actually bought it for my 96 year old mother. It really helps her understand the spatial relationships between various countries and allows her to follow the exploits of her great-grandchildren. The demarcation of borders and the size of the font is clear and easy to read, maybe with the help of a magnifying glass for the smaller countries.
customer_reviews.author: Shoreline shopper

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This globe was obviously used. The box was a bit torn at the opening and tape was cut. The base was scratched up where the batteries go. We thought, well, if it works we'll just go with it. Put batteries in, and the light glows, but BARELY. We had to turn our lights off to even see the faint glow. If there were directions with it, they were not included. It is very light weight. I guess for the price, that might be expected. This was to be a gift for our grandson's 6th birthday. Sadly, will have to return.
customer_reviews.author: JGR

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's fun. My kids like it. I wish they made one that was a little bigger, but that's not a complaint about this one. I was also surprised that the globe rotates normally, meaning it can be spun and spun. The construction has held up to a two year old and five year old for a few months now, and believe me, it does not just sit on a shelf. It's been thrown, dropped, turned off and on hundreds of times. It is pretty well constructed.
customer_reviews.author: Arodguynes

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed with the quality
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with the quality. I thought you would be able to light up individual countries etc... it is just a battery operated night light. :(
customer_reviews.author: CKG

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: After a month, this globe exceeded my expectations. Perfect for my 7 year old to learn. LED is not too bright and the countries are easily displayed. The detail is easy to read. This is about 25% smaller than a basketball and perfect for night time shelve. I did not want a big globe. Stable stand. Push button operation. I can’t think of negatives except some may want a bigger size.
customer_reviews.author: Baracas

customer_reviews.title: it is super tiny don't waste your money is super tiny
customer_reviews.text: If I would have known that this was so pathetically small I wouldn't have wasted so much of my money don't buy this it's tiny it literally almost fits in my hand but it's kind of hard to tell 6 year old that you can have it when it's hers so if it wasn't for that I would have returned this
customer_reviews.author: camil

customer_reviews.title: Not Just For Kids!
customer_reviews.text: When my 90-year-old mom moved to a small assisted living apartment, she gave up her large globe. Once in her new apartment, she realized she missed being able to look up countries on her globe. We decided on this one, as it is smaller and fits on a book shelf. She loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy H

customer_reviews.title: A nice buy
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these globes for children under 6. I was very pleased with them. They look really nice and it is easy to pick out the countries and oceans etc. It also seems that they are durable (as long as they are treated with the usual care). It was a disappointment to supply the 4 AA batteries needed. However once the globe was lit up it looked great. I do anticipate lots of fun while learning for the children.
customer_reviews.author: kathleen mcnamara

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart at the base all the time but my ...
customer_reviews.text: Falls apart at the base all the time but my daughter has been talking about the different parts of the world lately lol. She uses it for her night light and leaves it on till morning and hasn't killed my Amazon batteries yet
customer_reviews.author: Top Shelf

customer_reviews.title: Nice "starter" globe
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice "starter" globe. It includes all the basics and seems to be well-made. I wish it were about 2 inches bigger, but the larger globes are much more expensive. This size is fine for my grandson.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah A. Ingram

customer_reviews.title: Globe is a great teaching tool for our 4 year old grandchildren
customer_reviews.text: Globe is a great teaching tool for our 4 year old grandchildren. It's hard to explain how far away a certain city or country is because they, as 4 year olds, don't have a good perception of distance. Now they say "Wow" when they see how far something is. Nice price too.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas P. Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Love the lumination, is easier to read and find places.
customer_reviews.text: Love this luminated world globe. Have AFS STUDENTS now, I know where and how far they are from us and the cities they come from. I would recommend. Print is a bit small but, is a smaller globe, the lumination is helpful here. A+ seller
customer_reviews.author: Kimmer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in Globe
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed in the globe. It was much smaller than anticipated and very "cheap" quality & design. After my grandsons opened it, I didn't have the heart to take it away & send it back. If I had opened it beforehand, I would have sent it back for a refund and purchased a better quality globe even if it was more costly.
customer_reviews.author: C. Karas

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: I like this. I like how it lights up and really its just a standard globe. My problem with it is that it wobbles a ton when you spin it. The bottom doesn't have enough weight on it so you have to hold it down to spin the globe. Its also pretty small. A lot smaller than what I thought, definitely a globe for kids.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Harrold-Lewis

customer_reviews.title: No worth the cost.
customer_reviews.text: This item isn't what I was looking for in terms of price vs quality. Lightweight plastic stand causes it to be unsteady and is a concern for easy breakage. The lettering is too small in most cases to read without a magnifying glass. I would expect to find this product in the Five and Below store for $5. I and going to return it for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Angell

customer_reviews.title: The highlight of our living room "camping"
customer_reviews.text: My daughter and I LOVE this! She's just old enough to want to know where everything comes from. She wanted to know where this far away place that all her toys seem to come from... someplace called "China". We took that as an opportunity to show here where all sorts of things come from... in a tent... in the dark... in the living room. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Yoshi

customer_reviews.title: A must get
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect size and super vibrant! Plus a push botton to light it up! My son has special needs and absolutely loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Kris&Jessica

customer_reviews.title: The globe is a good size for young kids
customer_reviews.text: I bought this globe for my 4 year old (the box states it is for 8+ years - but it is suitable for under 8 years), and she has been very taken with it from the get-go. The globe is a good size for young kids. The bright colors (of each country) and the light make it more engaging. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tasha

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money buy a bigger and better globe.
customer_reviews.text: This globe was too small it did not suit my purpose. My grandson wanted to find the continents on this globe and they were not marked. I could show the areas but it was not what I wanted to show him. I have to buy another globe so it did not serve me at all. It was alluminated but the words were very small and hard to see.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap flimsy plastic
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a tiny, flimsy, wobbly plastic globe that lights up rather dimly. You can't really turn it without holding the base or it will nearly tip over. It has the quality of a plastic kids toy. It would be sufficient as a desktop nightlight but is fairly worthless as a globe. Finally - and this is something I should have realized from the product photos on Amazon - an 8 inch globe is tiny. There is a reason one of the photos on Amazon shows a girl using a magnifying glass, you'll need one to see anything...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My 6 and 4 year olds like it,
customer_reviews.text: LED light is cool, but (4) AA batteries go quick, recommend rechargeable batteries. Was a little smaller than I expected, but I didn't look close at size. Size is actually perfect for my kids.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: awesome little thing
customer_reviews.text: Really cool. My 4 year old loves it. She's learning basics right now so we don't mind the tiny print. The light makes it illuminate just bright enough to also use as a night light. Very cute overall.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: A perfect companion for a student
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my grandson.He has started studying geography in school and the Illuminated World Globe for Kids is a perfect study aid. I like globes better than maps as they are accurate in showing the size and position of each country. To have an accurate, lighted globe for this price is a steal.This is a perfect companion for a student.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Jeffreys

customer_reviews.title: Great for Kids
customer_reviews.text: My oldest loves her, but it's not that bright even when the battery is brand new. We have lots of fun talking about where we live in conjunction to others ... but some of the globe is impossible to read.
customer_reviews.author: S. A.

customer_reviews.title: Get bragged on!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my G-son of 7yrs old he loves it and is learning as we go. Gotta love that! The last thing he needs is another toy...Right! So buy this lovely globe you won't be sorry!!! Great gift like no other. I got bragged on for buying such a unique gift. I like that!! You will too!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customerkoret

customer_reviews.title: An illuminated globe is much easier to enjoy.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased it for my 8 year old grandson. He loves it. He likes to look up different countries on the globe to see the distance between those countries and where he lives. He really likes that it’s illuminated. Makes it so much easier to see.
customer_reviews.author: Karmen Q. Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Just the right size!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 41/2 year old granddaughter who is learning about the world, continents, and where things are in reference where she lives! She loves it and likes to use it as a night light at night.
customer_reviews.author: Marta Ashby

customer_reviews.title: Such a great gift!
customer_reviews.text: So adorable! Idk why I can't leave pictures in the review or I would. This was a huge hit with my 6yr old son. So far so good he leaves it on overnight as a nightlight too. Uses 4AA Batteries but it's such a cool globe and puts off a nice amount of light it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Superdude038

customer_reviews.title: Super Fun
customer_reviews.text: Desk piece. Another suggestion on my son's, teenager, Christmas List. It is a bit smaller than I expected;The dimensions were posted, so again, that is just me. I was clueless to how expensive Globes, in general, costs .....WOW but they're are some beautiful ones. My 16 yr old is very happy with this and actually smiled the biggest when he opened this gift!!! Thanks, Sherry Hoffman
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult to read because it's a miniature globe
customer_reviews.text: Looks like the consolation prize for a cheap carnival.... I bought it for my granddaughter and now I understand her disinterest, it's brightly lit junk worth 2-3 bucks tops
customer_reviews.author: Phil Harrell

customer_reviews.title: Get at least a 12" globe
customer_reviews.text: Too small, cheap, hard to read. I got a 12" GLOBE and it made a huge difference. A cheap globe is no deal if you have to strain to read it.
customer_reviews.author: al ridgway

customer_reviews.title: Wish it lit up more
customer_reviews.text: Really cute globe, good size. Disappointed in the fact that it's supposed to light up but even in a dark room you can BARELY tell that it's lit. Otherwise, it's a nice addition to our homeschool items.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for small rooms.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our 8 year old Grand daughter. We love that it has a night light for her... she doesn't sleep without one. It is smaller than the average globe, but her room is small with lots of stuff, so it works. We have had fun looking up lots of countries, then googling information about that country.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Cute globe for kids
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this globe. She wanted one so bad and we found this one that has the light. It isn't the sturdiest material but definitely worth the money when it comes to the price of globes!
customer_reviews.author: Molly Huston

customer_reviews.title: Not all that
customer_reviews.text: Really not very good quality considering the price. It’s small so the print is a struggle for some things. Very light weight. No cord, so it’s completely portable.
customer_reviews.author: T. Silveira

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for kids
customer_reviews.text: At first I wished this was bigger, but after using it with my children realized it’s perfect size for them! It lights up and it’s a really cool globe for learning!
customer_reviews.author: 143cand

customer_reviews.title: Great educational gift and night light
customer_reviews.text: My grandson absolutely loves this globe! He opened the box and said "WOW, ITS BEAUTIFUL"! truly the sweetest words from a 4 yr old and it functions as his night light at bedtime which makes it more relaxing for him. We now have to buy him astronaut Legos because the first thing he did was fly his Emmitt around the world. My grandson is on the spectrum and this gift brought him so much joy! 5 stars and more!
customer_reviews.author: Di McCulloch

customer_reviews.title: Cute but Small
customer_reviews.text: Look at measurements - this globe is very small. Also, it takes 4 AA batteries so it could prove kind of expensive to operate as a nightlight (which is what my grandson wanted it for). Very pretty. Don't know about accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri T. Chockley

customer_reviews.title: Built quality is very poor compare to its price $30
customer_reviews.text: Built quality is very poor compare to its price $30.00, it could be hardly $10 or little more, as it is manufactured in mass production unit. It is a light weight globe made with plastic, that is why when you will rotate it, you have to hold it. Also spindle that holds the globe is not mount correctly, do create noise and hard to move it. The light inside created this item little fancy to a certain degree but it doesn't help you to explore anything from the globe. Highly disappointed and do not recommend to buy at $30.00.
customer_reviews.author: BAMAPADA CHAKRABORTTY

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this globe, he is 5. His sister traveled to Japan on a Mission trip so we bought this globe to track her. We love that it lights up. It arrived on time and was as described by the seller. I would definitely recommend this product for those with curious little learners.
customer_reviews.author: tmrowan

customer_reviews.title: Higher quality than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my grandson whose 6th birthday was on December 23rd. He was very pleased by it and excited and plans to use it to look up different places in the world. I was pleased by the high quality of it and the nice looks.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Waste Your Money
customer_reviews.text: The globes map is map of some sort of plastic wrap. The moment it cracks or tears, which is pretty easy and fast, the globe falls apart and stops spinning.
customer_reviews.author: Rv0214

customer_reviews.title: Nice little illuminated globe for my 6 year old granddaughter- ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice little illuminated globe for my 6 year old granddaughter- will be giving if to her next week. It's small, but adequate for a first globe. Will make a nice night light too, if she wants. The quality seems good. If that changes with use, I will update.
customer_reviews.author: Suz

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work but Easy fix
customer_reviews.text: The globe looks good and was the size I figured it would be but it didn’t light up. I took the 4 screws out of the bottom, opened it and the wiring connects by a small clip but was apart. I snapped it back it and put the screws in and it worked great. It’s pretty cool for what it is. My son and I like it.
customer_reviews.author: KMK

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: This globe was gifted to my 8 year old. She was impressed by the light-up feature. Now using as a night light...it isn’t too bright so it works well in that aspect.
customer_reviews.author: Asia F.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic illuminated globe!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely happy with this globe! Light is soft enough to be used as a night light, and strong enough to light up the globe perfectly to see the world. Spins smooth on its axis. Shipping was super fast and well-packaged. My son has only had it 4 days and he's already understanding more about locations and names of countries! He doesn't even realize he's learning. Highly recommend this globe! My only recommendation is to improve this globe by using an a/c adapter along with batteries to extend the life of illumination if a child wants to use it as a night light.
customer_reviews.author: Buffy

customer_reviews.title: Love the light
customer_reviews.text: Its smaller than your schoolhouse globe but the light makes up for it. I can read the words on this one better than a bigger globe. I wish the base was weighted but it being easier to tip over has taught my 5 yr old not to be rough with it which is probably better anyway. It'll definitely be a globe that we use for years.
customer_reviews.author: shannon

customer_reviews.title: Even my sharp eyed six year  old cannot see little bitty Lichtenstein!
customer_reviews.text: Reasonably priced but a little bit too small even for my 6 year old. Came with absolutely zero packing only the box you would expect to contain it on a store shelf. The first one did not light up, I expect due to no protective packaging. Probably would not purchase again. Waiting to see if the second one survives shipment.
customer_reviews.author: Marcie

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love this globe! It is the perfect size to teach my third grader about the earth. The light makes it look beautiful in the dark. It seems well made and doesn’t tip over.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: TINY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: It’s cheaply made and ridiculously small! You can’t even see some countries. NOT WORTH 30$!!!
customer_reviews.author: Viktoria Groß

customer_reviews.title: Not worth $29.00
customer_reviews.text: This thing is not worth $29.00 and I would send it back, but my grandson loves it. So I guess the seller pulled one over on us. Such is shopping with Amazon. I don't recommend this globe at all. You can find a better one at Goodwill.
customer_reviews.author: Hot Tea Please

customer_reviews.title: Costco has better one for the same price
customer_reviews.text: It’s decent, but not wroth 29. I saw a better one at Costco for 28 or something. Bigger and better quality. I don’t have the box so I can’t really return it
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Fun and good quality
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 85 year old mother in law. She loves looking up places she sees on tv or reads about. The lighting helps her see it well if it’s getting dark outside.
customer_reviews.author: Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Colorful, but smaller
customer_reviews.text: This globe had great reviews so I purchased it for my classroom. I should have read the dimensions- it was much smaller than I had anticipated. The colors are great!
customer_reviews.author: Alambert

customer_reviews.title: Globe filled a need
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted! When we downsized from a house to a senior apartment I had to give up a large globe and we have been needing one.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Dukes

customer_reviews.title: So we ask her which one does she like better? She picked the Illuminated globe I bought
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter had looked at Globes and wanted one. So we ask her which one does she like better? She picked the Illuminated globe I bought. She does not know she is getting it for her birthday Aug. 30. Her Dad told her they couldn't afford it right now. So I bought it and gave it to her mom and pop to give her for her birthday. Thank you Amazon you always have what I want or am looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Elsie N. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Every Kid Needs One of These !
customer_reviews.text: Our world has grown so small and it's never too soon for our kids to know they are citizens of the world, not just one country. It will be a great Christmas gift for our toddler. Came nicely packed and that is much appreciated. A+
customer_reviews.author: P. Doornbos

customer_reviews.title: Best gift a 10 year old could hope for!!
customer_reviews.text: Gave as a gift for last Christmas.. Our neighbors 10 year old little girl LOVED IT! She really lived that it lite up.. She used it as her new bedroom night light!
customer_reviews.author: Harleylovinlife

customer_reviews.title: This is the perfect starter globe for our 6 year year old
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect starter globe for our 6 year year old. She had been asking for one for a while now, and this was exactly as described and great for the price. The glow feature is great. The only reason for the 4 star vs 5 star is because it runs only on 4 AA batteries. It was be greatly improved by adding a way to plug in for power. I'll update if the batteries drain quickly or if anything otherwise changes my positive opinion of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea!
customer_reviews.text: This made a 5 year old very happy. She likes that it lights up, and we can explain where different family members are around the world.
customer_reviews.author: justme

customer_reviews.title: Ok, not great
customer_reviews.text: Some places the writing overlaps, not all countries are labeled individually, some are lumped. It’s ok for little kids for learning, but would buy a bigger globe next time.
customer_reviews.author: Smith

customer_reviews.title: My 8 year old granddaughter was so excited when her ...
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old granddaughter was so excited when her Globe arrived. Now, she can grasp the "big picture" of the world she lives in. She recently became a pen pal to a girl in France. She can see where her friend actually is in comparison to where she lives. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: SweetBella's

customer_reviews.title: My 5 year old granddaughter picked this one out and loves it!!!
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old granddaughter helped to pick this globe out. She loves it! When she got it in she carried it around with her everywhere. Finally it sits on her nightstand as a nice night light. We are trying to teach her about planet earth and this is a great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Son loves it but cheap quality
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this. He loves maps/ globes and it was a great gift. But do I think it's worth 30 dollars. Definitely not.. It feels very cheap. Maybe 15 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Heatherjoy

customer_reviews.title: perfect toy
customer_reviews.text: it is very nice and y kids love to watch it and turn it. During the night it makes also a good level of light, not too strong and not too weak. The base connection is not very strong and I am afraid is not going to last too long
customer_reviews.author: MassimoB

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate information about Taiwan. Do not recommend it at all!
customer_reviews.text: Many inaccurate information about the map. Taiwan is an independent country but the globe names it as ‘Taiwan Tao’ instead of Taiwan, and include it as a city part of China. It’s ok if this globe targets at children in China. However, if you are selling your product to the US, you can’t put misleading information that teach children here that Taiwan is a ‘Tao’ and is not an independent country.
customer_reviews.author: Helen

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy! Illumination feature short lived.
customer_reviews.text: My grandson is eight. I bought this as a Christmas gift. Recently we were looking something up and thought the batteries needed to be changed only to discover they had corroded. The globe has been sitting on his Dresser (rarely used). How do batteries corrode in such a short time span?
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Kain

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply Made
customer_reviews.text: Very small, very cheaply made. Light is barely visible. Spend the $$ and get a better one!
customer_reviews.author: Sherry C.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to direct attention to locations around the world
customer_reviews.text: The size is smaller than I expected, but it works well in an overcrowded pre-teen bedroom. We are locating news sites and relatives locations around the world As a grandma I am taking on the geography lessons.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Cute, Hard to Read
customer_reviews.text: My son really liked how this globe can be lit up. I am a geography teacher, and for classroom use, I think it needs to be a bit bigger so the location names are easier to read.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer
